snippet.title: Hospital-acquired pneumonia: MedlinePlus Medical Encyclopedia
snippet.description: Hospital-acquired pneumonia is an infection of the lungs that occurs during a hospital stay. This type of pneumonia can be very severe. Sometimes it can be fatal.

snippet.title: Hospital-acquired pneumonia | University of Maryland Medical ...
snippet.description: Definition. Hospital-acquired pneumonia is an infection of the lungs that occurs during a hospital stay. This type of pneumonia can be very severe.

snippet.title: Hospital-Acquired Pneumonia \- Medscape
snippet.description: A review of the risk factors for hospital-acquired pneumonia, diagnostic testing, and treatment strategies.

snippet.title: Pneumonia Can Be Prevented - Vaccines Can Help - CDC Features
snippet.description: When someone develops pneumonia in the community (not in a hospital), it's called community-acquired pneumonia (CAP).

snippet.description: Dexamethasone Infusion in Community-acquired Pneumonia (Ovidius). This study has been completed. First Received on May 8, 2007. Last Updated on September 24, 2010 History of Changes.

snippet.title: Hospital-acquired pneumonia \- Wikipedia
snippet.description: Hospital-acquired pneumonia (HAP) or nosocomial pneumonia refers to any pneumonia contracted by a patient in a hospital at least 48–72 hours after being admitted. It is usually caused by a bacterial infection, rather than a virus.
